intro: Calysphyrum pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered calysphyrum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Calysphyrum pauciflorum is often found in wetlands and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
